results.title: Family down the Fraser
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, ONF | NFB and Tony Westman
results.brief_description: Richard and Rochelle Wright and their two sons travelled the Fraser River from Cache Tete Jaune to the Pacific coast in a rubber raft. In addition to being a great adventure, the trip brought them into contact with people who told them some of the history of the river, and acquainted them with lifestyles vastly different from their own citified ways.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Taylor, ONF | NFB and Tony Westman

results.title: Family day care [Greek version]
results.creator_credit: Robin Hughes, Film Australia and Karl McPhee
results.brief_description: Designed to describe all aspects of the family Day Care Scheme, financed by the Department of Social Security, the film follows a co-ordinator of a scheme in the inner Sydney suburb Marackville. Through her day-to-day experiences we see different kinds of care being given to children’s differing needs and we see colourful experiences designed for the children by highly skilled care-givers. Cinematography by John Hosking. In Greek and English.

results.title: Family day care
results.creator_credit: Robin Hughes, Film Australia and Karl McPhee
results.brief_description: Additional credits are: script- Karl McPhee; photographer- John Hosking; editor- Karl Sodersten; sound- Max Hensser, Julian Ellingworth. Pam Goodwin is one of the co-ordinators of a Family Day Care Program. Her job entails interviewing parents and helping them find the kind of care that they want for their children, and interviewing the women who want to mind children and helping them in this role.

results.title: Family Court
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, Peter Campbell, Family Court of Australia and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 58 of Series “English at work”.
This video explains the role of the Family Court in divorce cases. It explains the grounds for applying for divorce, and the issues involved in a divorce in Australia. It also explains options offered by the Family Court after an application for divorce has been made: the structure of Information sessions, conciliation conferences, and court counsellors to help resolve differences in the main areas of dispute; children and property.

results.title: Family circles
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Gudrun Parker, Tom Daly and Morten Parker
results.brief_description: Shows how the interplay of home and school influences the development of children. The experiences of three children illustrate vividly how parental indifference, lack of imagination, and emotional conflict at home can destroy the confidence and enthusiasm necessary for a child’s success at school. (Awards: Cleveland; Toronto; Montevideo)

results.title: Family camping
results.brief_description: For the family on a camping vacation for the first time, or even for the experienced camper, this color film is a congenial and informative guide. It shows popular forms of camping: site camping; a hiking trip; canoe camping in the backwoods; cruise camping through more travelled waters; and trail riding in the Rockies. Each is seen to have its own attractions.

results.title: Family and pets
results.creator_credit: Maija Rove, Griffith University and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Dragon’s tongue”.
This first episode introduces the phrases “What is your name?”, “How old are you?” and their answers, “This is”, “He is” and “She is” and words for family members and pets. At the same time we are shown the homes of two different families in Beijing, glimpses of children at school, a zoo visit and the pets the Chinese keep. We also have a brief introduction to calligraphy and how the modern pictograms have developed. Introduced by Colin McKerras. In Mandarin and English.

results.title: Family
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Cherry, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Rebecca has been involved in various capacities in Legacy since her father died when she was seven. Rebecca talks about the different families in her life, especially the one she has found at Legacy. She has gone from being a Rotary Exchange student to a Legacy leader.
